---
title: Wood Canada
author: ''
date: '2022-08-30'
slug: wood_canada
categories: []
tags: []
images:
  - /img/cover.png
r_init: |-
  
description: The Government of Canada spent an estimated $3.9M
  in 2021-2022 on contracts with Wood Canada. The average
  contract duration was 0.88 years, and the average contract value
  (not including contracts under $10k) was $89.7K. The longest
  contract was 7.1 years. The largest contract by value (including
  amendments) was $2.5M.
lookup_name: 'WOOD CANADA'
most_recent_fiscal_year_total: '3.9M'
most_recent_fiscal_year_year: '2021-2022'
s431_number_of_contracts: '338'
s431_number_of_contracts_with_amendments: '55'
s431_number_of_contracts_amendments_percentage: '16%'
s432_mean_amendment_increase_percentage: '55%'
s434_mean_number_of_amendments: '1.42'
s433_total_amendment_increase_value: '5.0M'
s424_mean_duration: '0.88'
s421_mean_contract_value: '89.7K'
s425_max_duration: '7.1'
s422_max_contract_value: '2.5M'
---
